RT @biancoresearch: The problem with the "everything hits the fan" scenario, is what does the Fed do if it actually happens?

Right now, th‚Ä¶

The problem with the "everything hits the fan" scenario, is what does the Fed do if it actually happens?

Right now, the funds rate is 0%.  They have nothing to cut. 

But does printing more with 7.5% inflation fix a "everything hits the fan" scenario?

The fed funds futures market is now pricing in a 5% probability of NO HIKE in March.  First time in many weeks NO HIKE is on the board.

And no, this is not bullish.  

5% NO HIKE in March means the market is starting to price in a "everything hits the fan" scenario. https://t.co/Yn3LMkFJUC
